Uses of Package
common

  • Packages that use common 
    Package Description
    batch  
    common
    Contains shared foundational utilities for byte-level data handling and low-level operations.
    heif
    Provides high-level classes for parsing and manipulating HEIF-based files.
    heif.boxes
    Classes for parsing and representing individual HEIF-structured boxes.
    jpg
    Classes for parsing and manipulating JPEG-based files are found here.
    png
    Functionality for parsing and processing PNG image files is provided here.
    tif
    Classes for parsing and manipulating TIFF-based files.
    webp  
  • Classes in common used by batch 
    Class and Description
    DigitalSignature
    Enumerates known image formats by identifying their distinct magic numbers in the image file header.
  • Classes in common used by common 
    Class and Description
    AbstractByteReader
    This abstract class provides the functionality to perform reader operations intended for obtaining data from a byte array.
    AbstractImageParser
    An abstract superclass for implementing image file parsers.
    BaseMetadata
    A marker interface that enables multiple metadata sub-types to share a common super-type.
    DigitalSignature
    Enumerates known image formats by identifying their distinct magic numbers in the image file header.
    ImageReadErrorException
    This exception is thrown when the running application is terminated abruptly.
    Metadata
    Represents a generic metadata container capable of storing and managing directory elements of type T.
    RationalNumber
    This class represents a rational number, typically used in the TIFF image format.
    RationalNumber.DataType 
    TestScanner
    Obtains metadata from selected supported image file formats.

    Class and Description
    AbstractImageParser

    Enumerates known image formats by identifying their distinct magic numbers in the image file header.
    ImageHandler
    Defines the contract for a handler that processes image files and extracts structured metadata.
    ImageReadErrorException
    This exception is thrown when the running application is terminated abruptly.
    Metadata
    Represents a generic metadata container capable of storing and managing directory elements of type T.
    SequentialByteReader
    Performs sequential reading of primitive data types from a byte array.
